measured_by: mutual information between states and actions (Iπ(S;A))
justification: The article states: "Policy complexity is formally defined as the mutual information between states and actions, which measures the average number of bits necessary to encode a policy."
The methods section notes: "Throughout this paper, we will use the term policy cost to refer to log π(a|s) / P(a)."

measured_by: milliseconds elapsed between stimulus onset and key-press response
justification: In the experimental tasks participants had to press a key within a 1–2 s window and the model uses "log RT" (response time in milliseconds) as an outcome variable.

measured_by: difference in proportion of choosing the high-marginal-probability action versus other equally rewarded actions
justification: For Tasks 1–3 the paper computes ΔP(A) to quantify how often participants select an action with high marginal probability over alternatives, describing this as a measure of perseverative action bias.
